subject: Re: More changes to Wolper movewell pages

full_threads.body: Closing this - will reopen when there are new updates. Also, seem like the page is published now - all good 🙏

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Adriane Roa

full_threads.body:
Hi Michelle,

Just to confirm, we saw your email about the MoveWell Exercise Program v2 page — thanks for checking in. We’ve responded in that thread and have already applied the updates on the test page.

  • Regarding this request for the “How to Book MoveWell Classes” page, would you like us to go ahead and push these changes live now?

Everything is updated and ready on our end, but we wanted to check with you first to make sure it’s good to go. If you’d prefer to review anything further or have small tweaks in mind before it goes live, we’re very happy to take care of those as well.

Looking forward to your confirmation — we’re always happy to help!

Hi Marcelo,

That looks great - thank you.

Did you see my email about changes to the MoveWell test page? - https://wolper.com.au/services/movewell-exercise-program-v2/

Michelle.

Ticket Summary – MoveWell “How to Book” Page (#183379)

Client: Michelle Stockley, Wolper Jewish Hospital
Page: How to Book MoveWell Classes – Draft Link
Status: Completed / Ready for Review

Request:
  • Embed Mindbody booking widgets for the 11-week, 12-week, and casual classes.
  • Style buttons according to Wolper branding and layout preferences.
  • Later update: replace buttons with text links under headings while keeping three bottom buttons intact.

Actions Taken:
  1. Initial Setup:
    • Draft page created in WordPress (WPBakery).
      Booking widgets embedded for:
      • 11-week term (Monday, Friday, Saturday)
      • 12-week term (Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday)
      • Casual classes
    • Buttons styled per requested colors and layout using custom CSS.
    • Layout made responsive, including stacking buttons vertically on mobile.
  2. Client Revision:
    • Buttons under class headings replaced with clickable text links, following the style of existing forms (medical clearance, terms & conditions).
    • Casual class link updated to clickable text.
    • Three bottom buttons retained as originally styled.

Outcome:
  • The page is fully updated and ready for client review.
  • Links and buttons are functioning correctly.
  • Layout and styling are consistent across desktop and mobile devices.

Next Steps / Notes:
  • Client to review the page and confirm if any further adjustments are required.

Hi Michelle,

Thank you for your feedback. We’ve updated the “How to Book MoveWell Classes” daft page according to your latest instructions.

Here’s what’s been adjusted:

  • The class links under Term 1 2026 and Payment options now appear as clickable text links rather than buttons, matching the style used for the medical clearance and Terms & Conditions forms.
  • The Casual Classes section link is now clickable as requested.
  • The three buttons at the bottom of the page remain as they were, styled and positioned correctly.


The page has been fully updated and is ready for your review: How to Book MoveWell Classes

Everything should now be displaying and functioning as you requested, but if you notice anything else or want further tweaks, just let us know — we’re always happy to help.

Thank you Marcelo,

It's looking good.

I think I would prefer the links below to be just links rather than have the buttons.
Similar to what you have done for this medical clearance form and Movewell Terms & Conditions form.

So, under the headings Term 1 2026 - class term length and Payment options people can click on the following lines:
Monday, Friday and Saturday classes: 11-week term (click to 11 week script) and
Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday classes: 12-week term (click to 12 week script)

Under the Casual Classes heading, please should click on
You can view and book casual classes available in the week ahead here: (click to the casual classes script)
Then we will have the three buttons at the bottom of the page which are perfect.

Thank you,

Michelle.

Ticket Issue/Summary:
Date: December 26, 2025

The client requested that Mindbody booking widgets be embedded on the new “How to book” MoveWell page within the WordPress (WPBakery) environment. Widgets needed to appear as styled buttons.

Action Items / Implementation:
  1. CSS Styling & Layout
    • Custom CSS classes applied for buttons (.wolper-mb-button-green, .wolper-btn-style, etc.) with specific colors:
      • 11-Week Term / 12-Week Term: Wolper Green #7bbd42
      • Casual Class: Wolper Red #d12b2b
      • Bottom Row Buttons: Blue #6cb5e1, Green #8cc65a, Orange #d47a45
        Flexbox used for layout:
      • Rows: Vertically center buttons with descriptive text
      • Bottom Row: 3-column layout, stacking vertically on mobile

Conclusion:
The new MoveWell draft page has been fully updated with Mindbody booking widgets embedded, styled according to the client’s specifications. Layout is responsive, and buttons match the requested color scheme. Page is ready for client review and further adjustments if needed.

Hi Michelle,

I wanted to let you know that the new “How to book” draft page has been fully set up and is ready for your review.

The updates include:
  • Booking widgets inserted for the 11-week and 12-week terms.
  • Three buttons at the bottom in Blue, Green, and Orange with the requested border styling.

You can preview the page here: How to Book MoveWell Classes

Everything is ready for review, and once you’ve had a chance to look, I can make any adjustments or proceed with the next updates right away.

If there is anything else you need in the meantime, please do not hesitate to reach out—we are always happy to help!

Hi Michelle,

Thanks for sending this over. I hope you are having a wonderful holiday break!

Thanks for sending this over! We’ve got your updates and the document, and we’re on it. We’ll add the scripts to the draft page exactly where you’ve indicated and make sure everything is ready for you.

Once you have any additional changes, just send them our way and we’ll take care of the rest.

If there is anything else you need in the meantime, please do not hesitate to reach out—we are always happy to help!

action.text: Marcelo Meneses assigned to Marcelo Meneses

full_threads.body:
Hey Michelle,

Thanks for reaching out. We’ve received your ticket and our team is now looking into it.

Just a quick note: due to the holiday season, updates may take a little longer than usual.

In the event of an emergency, you may contact us by phone at 1300 072 134.

Rest assured, we’ll get back to you as soon as possible.

Wishing you a wonderful festive season

Hi Marcelo,

I have created a new post in the CMS and have done as much as I can on it.
Attached is a doc showing the places on the page that I need your help with to add the scripts.

The page is saved as a draft and its link is : https://wolper.com.au/how-to-book-movewell-classes/
It's called How to book your MoveWell classes


I will be back next week to continue working on these pages.

Thank you,

Michelle.
